trans-unit.source: Sets the font for a control.

seg-source.mrk: Sets the font for a control.

target.mrk: Sets the font for a control.

trans-unit.source: The control identifier (controlID) as returned by a GUICtrlCreate...() function, or -1 for the last created control.

seg-source.mrk: The control identifier (controlID) as returned by a GUICtrlCreate...() function, or -1 for the last created control.

target.mrk: The control identifier (controlID) as returned by a GUICtrlCreate...() function, or -1 for the last created control.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The weight of the font in the range 0 through 1000. For example, 400 is normal and 700 is bold. If this value is zero, a default weight is used.

seg-source.mrk: The weight of the font in the range 0 through 1000.
For example, 400 is normal and 700 is bold.
If this value is zero, a default weight is used.

target.mrk: The weight of the font in the range 0 through 1000.
For example, 400 is normal and 700 is bold.
If this value is zero, a default weight is used.

trans-unit.source: The following values are defined for convenience.

seg-source.mrk: The following values are defined for convenience.

target.mrk: The following values are defined for convenience.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Font attributes, which can be a combination of the following added together:

seg-source.mrk: Font attributes, which can be a combination of the following added together:

target.mrk: Font attributes, which can be a combination of the following added together:

trans-unit.source: [optional] Name of the font to use. (OS default GUI font is used if the font is "" or is not found).

seg-source.mrk: Name of the font to use.
(OS default GUI font is used if the font is "" or is not found).

target.mrk: Name of the font to use.
(OS default GUI font is used if the font is "" or is not found).

trans-unit.source: [optional] Font quality to select. The following qualities are accepted:
$DEFAULT_QUALITY (0) = Appearance of the font does not matter.

seg-source.mrk: $DEFAULT_QUALITY (0) = Appearance of the font does not matter.

target.mrk: $DEFAULT_QUALITY (0) = Appearance of the font does not matter.

trans-unit.source: $DRAFT_QUALITY (1) = Appearance of the font is less important than when $PROOF_QUALITY is used. For GDI raster fonts, scaling is enabled, which means that more font sizes are available, but the quality may be lower. Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized if necessary.

seg-source.mrk: $DRAFT_QUALITY (1) = Appearance of the font is less important than when $PROOF_QUALITY is used.
For GDI raster fonts, scaling is enabled, which means that more font sizes are available, but the quality may be lower.
Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized if necessary.

target.mrk: $DRAFT_QUALITY (1) = Appearance of the font is less important than when $PROOF_QUALITY is used.
For GDI raster fonts, scaling is enabled, which means that more font sizes are available, but the quality may be lower.
Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized if necessary.

trans-unit.source: $PROOF_QUALITY (2) = (default) Character quality of the font is more important than exact matching of the logical-font attributes. For GDI raster fonts, scaling is disabled and the font closest in size is chosen. Although the chosen font size may not be mapped exactly when $PROOF_QUALITY is used, the quality of the font is high and there is no distortion of appearance. Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized if necessary.

seg-source.mrk: $PROOF_QUALITY (2) = (default) Character quality of the font is more important than exact matching of the logical-font attributes.
For GDI raster fonts, scaling is disabled and the font closest in size is chosen.
Although the chosen font size may not be mapped exactly when $PROOF_QUALITY is used, the quality of the font is high and there is no distortion of appearance.
Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized if necessary.

target.mrk: $PROOF_QUALITY (2) = (default) Character quality of the font is more important than exact matching of the logical-font attributes.
For GDI raster fonts, scaling is disabled and the font closest in size is chosen.
Although the chosen font size may not be mapped exactly when $PROOF_QUALITY is used, the quality of the font is high and there is no distortion of appearance.
Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized if necessary.

trans-unit.source: $ANTIALIASED_QUALITY (4) = Font is always antialiased if the font supports it and the size of the font is not too small or too large.

seg-source.mrk: $ANTIALIASED_QUALITY (4) = Font is always antialiased if the font supports it and the size of the font is not too small or too large.

target.mrk: $ANTIALIASED_QUALITY (4) = Font is always antialiased if the font supports it and the size of the font is not too small or too large.

trans-unit.source: $CLEARTYPE_QUALITY (5) = If set, text is rendered (when possible) using ClearType antialiasing method. See the remarks on the msdn page for LOGFONT for details about when cleartype is not available.

seg-source.mrk: $CLEARTYPE_QUALITY (5) = If set, text is rendered (when possible) using ClearType antialiasing method.
See the remarks on the msdn page for LOGFONT for details about when cleartype is not available.

target.mrk: $CLEARTYPE_QUALITY (5) = If set, text is rendered (when possible) using ClearType antialiasing method.
See the remarks on the msdn page for LOGFONT for details about when cleartype is not available.

trans-unit.source: If neither $ANTIALIASED_QUALITY nor $NONANTIALIASED_QUALITY is selected, the font is antialiased only if the user chooses smooth screen fonts in Control Panel.

seg-source.mrk: If neither $ANTIALIASED_QUALITY nor $NONANTIALIASED_QUALITY is selected, the font is antialiased only if the user chooses smooth screen fonts in Control Panel.

target.mrk: If neither $ANTIALIASED_QUALITY nor $NONANTIALIASED_QUALITY is selected, the font is antialiased only if the user chooses smooth screen fonts in Control Panel.

trans-unit.source: By default, controls use the font set by GUISetFont().

seg-source.mrk: By default, controls use the font set by GUISetFont().

target.mrk: By default, controls use the font set by GUISetFont().

trans-unit.source: See the Appendix for a complete list of Windows fonts and the Windows versions under which they are supported.

seg-source.mrk: See the Appendix for a complete list of Windows fonts and the Windows versions under which they are supported.

target.mrk: See the Appendix for a complete list of Windows fonts and the Windows versions under which they are supported.

trans-unit.source: Size can contain a decimal as in 8.5.

seg-source.mrk: Size can contain a decimal as in 8.5.

target.mrk: Size can contain a decimal as in 8.5.

trans-unit.source: For some controls such as labels, the default size can be 8.5 instead of 9 according to Windows Theme Values.

seg-source.mrk: For some controls such as labels, the default size can be 8.5 instead of 9 according to Windows Theme Values.

target.mrk: For some controls such as labels, the default size can be 8.5 instead of 9 according to Windows Theme Values.

trans-unit.source: For Quality parameter check MSDN, some Windows XP installation need CLEARTYPE_QUALITY=5

seg-source.mrk: For Quality parameter check MSDN, some Windows XP installation need CLEARTYPE_QUALITY=5

target.mrk: For Quality parameter check MSDN, some Windows XP installation need CLEARTYPE_QUALITY=5

trans-unit.source: Font type to be used for setting the font of the controls.

target.mrk: Font type to be used for setting the font of the controls.
